AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Raymond McMillon: defendant, appellant, and passenger in a tractor-trailer with undocumented aliens, convicted of alien transportation offenses, traveled with co-defendant to Laredo, questioned by Agent Pena at an immigration checkpoint, filed a motion to dismiss the indictment on speedy trial grounds, sentenced to 41 months' imprisonment, argues about the lawfulness of Agent Pena's immigration questions, claimed to have a possessory interest in the tractor-trailer due to a commercial purpose, appealed the district court's factual findings, had his speedy trial clock begin on July 8, 2014, and filed multiple motions to continue, including a motion to suppress and a motion for discovery of canine records, filed a motion to dismiss the indictment, defendant whose ability to adequately prepare for the case would have been affected if continuances were not granted, argues against excluding delay periods
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Zeba Williams: co-defendant, driver of the tractor-trailer, asked McMillon to accompany him to pick up commercial equipment, questioned by Agent Pena at an immigration checkpoint, gave consent for search of tractor's sleeper area, testified about the events during the suppression hearing, voluntarily consented to the search
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Raymond McMillon and Zeba Williams: pair who traveled together from Houston to San Antonio and then to Laredo, questioned by Agent Pena at an immigration checkpoint, defendants in the case who requested continuances to file pretrial motions
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Luis Pena: Border Patrol Agent who approached the driver-side door at an immigration checkpoint near Freer, Texas, questioned Williams and McMillon, discovered a person hidden in the tractor's sleeper area, testified as a government witness during the jury trial, asked immigration questions, conducted a checkpoint stop within permissible duration, initiated the search of the tractor-trailer, credibly testified about the events
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Manuel Hernandez: Border Patrol Agent who prepared to have his canine perform a sniff of the tractor-trailer's exterior, worked with Agent Pena during the stop, testified as a government witness during the jury trial, told Agent Pena to check the back of the tractor-trailer
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon De La Cruz: undocumented alien transported by McMillon, testified as a government witness during the jury trial
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Miguel Hernandez-Gomez: undocumented alien transported by McMillon, testified as a government witness during the jury trial
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Luis Pena and Manuel Hernandez: agents who conducted the checkpoint stop and search of the tractor-trailer, testified about the events during the suppression hearing
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Martinez-Fuerte: referenced in a legal context regarding checkpoint stops and detentions
